info.title: Entity API
info.description:
Flexible data layer for epilot Entities.

Use this API configure and access your business objects like Contacts, Opportunities and Products.

[Feature Documentation](https://docs.epilot.io/docs/entities/flexible-entities)

tags.name: Import-Export
tags.description: Import and Export entities via portable files (CSV)

get.description: Get the latest versions of all schemas

parameters.name: unpublished
parameters.description: Return unpublished draft schemas

get.description: By default gets the latest version of the Schema and to get the specific version of schema pass the id.

put.description: Create or update a schema with a new version

delete.description: Delete a schema, or a specific version of a schema

get.description: Get formal JSON schema definition draft 2020-12 for the given epilot schema

_org.description: Organization Id the entity belongs to

items.description:
The user / organization owning this entity.

Note: Owner implicitly has access to the entity regardless of ACLs.

_manifest.description: Manifest ID used to create/update the entity

_acl.description: Access control list (ACL) for an entity. Defines sharing access to external orgs or users.

address.description: Addresses as a list of object, the element with index 0 is treated as the primary one.

email.description: Email addresses as a list of object, the element with index 0 is treated as the primary one.

phone.description: Phone numbers as a list of object, the element with index 0 is treated as the primary one.

get.description: Get a full example entity for the given schema
Get all versions of this schema ordered by the latest versions including drafts.
List canonical versions of all available schemas

post.description:
List entities that meet the specified conditions.

Supports the same options as entity search but utilizes filtering using a subset of [Elastic Query DSL](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/query-dsl.html) and does not perform scoring.
Validates an entity against the schema.
Validates an entity against the schema.

patch.description:
Create or update an entity using `unique_key`

- If no entities are matched, a new entity is created.
- If exactly one entity is matched, a `PATCH`-style update is applied to the existing entity.

## Activity

If no `activity_id` query parameter is provided, implicitly creates Activity of type `EntityCreated` or `EntityUpdated`

parameters.name: strict
parameters.description: Strict mode = return 409 if more than one entity is matched

405.description: Deleted entities cannot be updated. You'll need to recover the entity first before updating.

409.description: Conflict: multiple entities were matched with `unique_key`

get.description:
Gets Entity by id.

Supports `hydrate` and `fields` parameters to control the shape of the response.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of entity fields to include in results

patch.description:
Restores an entity by id

## Activity

If no `activity_id` query parameter is provided, implicitly creates Activity of type `EntityRestore`

schema.description: This endpoint doesn't require a payload, but an empty object can be sent to satisfy certain HTTP clients.

delete.description:
Deletes an Entity

## Activity

If no `activity_id` query parameter is provided, implicitly creates Activity of type `EntityDeleted`

## Deletion Mode

All entities are soft deleted by default. To force an actual deletion from the system, provide `purge:true` to delete the entity and all its activity history permanently.

parameters.name: purge
parameters.description: Permanently deletes the entity when set to `true`

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Input to autocomplete

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: Autocomplete attribute

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Limit results to entity schema

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

post.description:
Create an activity that can be displayed in activity feeds.

- All activites are published as events on the event bus
- Entity mutations are always part of an activity

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of entities which the activity primarily concerns

get.description: Get activity by id

parameters.name: operations_size
parameters.description: Maximum number of operations to include in response (default: 10)

parameters.name: operations_from
parameters.description: Pagination offset for operations

post.description: Attach existing activity to entity activity feeds

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of entities which the activity primarily concerns

get.description: Get activity feed for an entity

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Get activities after this timestamp

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: get activities before this timestamp

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: max number of results to return

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by activity type

parameters.name: include_relations
parameters.description: Include activities from related entities

get.description:
Returns 1st level direct relations for an entity.

You can control whether to return the full entity or just the relation item with the `?hydrate` query param.

Reverse relations i.e. entities referring to this entity are included with the `?include_reverse` query param.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page

post.description: Relates one or more entities to parent entity by adding items to a relation attribute

delete.description: Disassociate one or more entities to parent entity by removing items to a relation attribute

get.description:
Returns 1st level direct relations for an entity with pagination.

You can control whether to return the full entity or just the relation item with the `?hydrate` query param.

Reverse relations i.e. entities referring to this entity are included with the `?include_reverse` query param.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Input to filter search results

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of entity fields to include in results

get.description:
Returns 1st level direct relations for an entity with pagination.

You can control whether to return the full entity or just the relation item with the `?hydrate` query param.

Reverse relations i.e. entities referring to this entity are included with the `?include_reverse` query param.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page

get.description: Returns the amount of unique related entities for an entity - includes direct and reverse relations.

put.description: Updates an existing relation between two entities.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: The attribute that express meaning

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: The attribute that express meaning

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: The attribute that express meaning

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: The attribute that express meaning

post.description:
Export entity data in a CSV-format. The export will export data as close as possible to what is visible on Entity UI tables.
The values exported as in some cases, transformed to human-readable values.

To force the export of raw values, use the `#` prefix in front of your field name when specifying the field on the `fields` param.

parameters.name: job_id
parameters.description: Export Job Id to get the result

parameters.name: is_template
parameters.description: Pass 'true' to generate import template

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Export headers translation language

201.description: created export url and download url

post.description:
This endpoint enables the import of entities into the platform.
The entities should be provided in a CSV format inside an S3 bucket.
This API will return the `job_id`` which can be used to fetch the status of the import process.

parameters.name: job_id
parameters.description: The ID of the import job. This ID is used to track the progress and fetch the result of the import operation.

201.description:
The import operation was initiated successfully.
The response includes the URLs for the files containing the successful and failed imported entities.

get.description: List taxonomy classifications for a given schema

Gets bulk actions jobs by job status:
- <undefined> = all active jobs
- PENDING = all active jobs
- FAILED = all failed jobs
- COMPLETED = all completed jobs

parameters.description: The status of the jobs to return
parameters.name: status

schema.description: The maximum number of jobs to return (defaults to 20)

200.description: Returns the jobs matching the given query or the active jobs if no status is provided

get.description: Gets a bulk action job by job id

200.description: Returns the job matching the given job id

post.description:
Moves classifications from one taxonomy to another, through a bulk async operation which
also updates all references from the old classification to the new one under the target taxonomy.

job_id.description: Job ID for tracking the status of a bulk operation request

target_taxonomy.description: The target taxonomy to which the classifications will be moved

200.description: Returns the job id for the async job and current status

post.description:
Permanently deletes taxonomy classifications. The classifications are deleted through a bulk
async operation which also deletes all references of the deleted classifications from the entities
referencing them.

job_id.description: Job ID for tracking the status of a bulk operation request

200.description: Returns the job id for the async job and current status

EpilotAuth.description: Authorization header with epilot OAuth2 bearer token

EpilotOrg.description: Overrides the target organization to allow shared tenantaccess
EpilotOrg.name: x-epilot-org-id

ExportJobId.description: The unique identifier of the import job.

EntitySchema.description: The "type" of an Entity. Describes the shape. Includes Entity Attributes, Relations and Capabilities.

feature_flag.description: This schema should only be active when the feature flag is enabled

enable_setting.description: This schema should only be active when one of the organization settings is enabled

name.description: User-friendly identifier for the entity schema

title_template.description: Template for rendering the title field. Uses handlebars

anyOf.description: List of attributes to show in list item

content_direction.description: Show attributes in a row or column

show_sharing_button.description: Show the sharing button in entity detail view

group_settings.description: A list of Group Titles and associated settings if present.

info_tooltip_title.default: These informations are provided by the partner company and cannot be edited.

layout_settings.description:
Custom grid definitions for the layout. These settings are composed by managed and un-managed properties:
- Managed Properties: are interpreted and transformed into layout styles
- Un-managed Properties: are appended as styles into the attribute mounting node

grid_gap.description: Defines the grid gap for the mounting node of the attribute.

grid_template_columns.description: Defines the grid column template for the mounting node of the attribute.

attributes.description: An ordered list of attributes the entity contains

prompt.description: The prompt to generate the filters
prompt.example: Show me all contacts that are not customers

label.description: The label for the search filter

type.description: The type for the search filter

value.description: The value for the search filter

label.description: The label for the filter option

label_type.description: The label type for the filter option

name.description: The name for the filter option

group.description: The group for the filter option

items.description: The allowed schemas for the filter option

relatedOptions.description: The related options for the filter option

render_condition.description: Only render group when render_condition resolves to true

_purpose.description: Only render group when one of the purposes is enabled

_manifest.description: Manifest ID used to create/update the schema group

feature_flag.description: This group should only be active when the feature flag is enabled

settings_flag.description: This group should only be active when all the settings have the correct value

allOf.description: a readonly computed ID for the group including schema slug and the group ID

schema.description: Schema slug the group belongs to

allOf.description: a readonly computed ID for the attribute including schema slug and the attribute ID

schema.description: Schema slug the attribute belongs to

hidden.description: Do not render attribute in entity views

show_in_table.description: Render as a column in table views. When defined, overrides `hidden`

sortable.description: Allow sorting by this attribute in table views if `show_in_table` is true

group.description: Which group the attribute should appear in. Accepts group ID or group name

hide_label.description: When set to true, will hide the label of the field.

icon.description:
Code name of the icon to used to represent this attribute.
The value must be a valid @epilot/base-elements Icon name

render_condition.description:
Defines the conditional rendering expression for showing this field.
When a valid expression is parsed, their evaluation defines the visibility of this attribute.
Note: Empty or invalid expression have no effect on the field visibility.

_manifest.description: Manifest ID used to create/update the schema attribute

constraints.description:
A set of constraints applicable to the attribute.
These constraints should and will be enforced by the attribute renderer.

feature_flag.description: This attribute should only be active when the feature flag is enabled

settings_flag.description: This attribute should only be active when one of the provided settings have the correct value

entity_builder_disable_edit.description: Setting to `true` disables editing the attribute on the entity builder UI

protected.description: Setting to `true` prevents the attribute from being modified / deleted

info_helpers.description: A set of configurations meant to document and assist the user in filling the attribute.

hint_text.description:
The text to be displayed in the attribute hint helper.
When specified it overrides the `hint_text_key` configuration.

hint_text_key.description:
The key of the hint text to be displayed in the attribute hint helper.
The key should be a valid i18n key.

hint_custom_component.description:
The name of the custom component to be used as the hint helper.
The component should be registered in the `@epilot360/entity-ui` on the index of the components directory.
When specified it overrides the `hint_text` or `hint_text_key` configuration.

hint_tooltip_placement.description:
The placement of the hint tooltip.
The value should be a valid `@mui/core` tooltip placement.

allow_any.description: Allow arbitrary input values in addition to provided options

disable_case_sensitive.description: controls if the matching of values against the options is case sensitive or not

allow_extra_options.description: controls if the 360 ui will allow the user to enter a value which is not defined by the options

allow_any.description: Allow arbitrary input values in addition to provided options

value.description: The stored value of the option

title.description: The displayed title of the option

prefix.description: Prefix added before the sequence number

allowed_extensions.description: List of file extensions (without the dot suffix)

display_images_landscaped.description: Controls how the images are presented to the user during upload on the Entity Details view.

enable_description.description:
When set to true, an i18n description will be used alongside the attribute label.
This description should be set through the platform locales in the form: `file.{attribute_name}.description_text`.

currency.description: An array of currency configurations with a country code (ISO-4217)

SummaryField.description: Summary Fields are displayed inside list view as a resume of the relation entity.

field.description: The field from the entity attributes to display

display_as.description: An hint on how to display the summary field

EntityAction.description: An entity action configured from the entity schema

permission.description:
Permission required to show the action.
If not provided, the action will be shown to all users.

reverse_attributes.description: Map of schema slug to target relation attribute

relation_affinity_mode.description: Weak relation attributes are kept when duplicating an entity. Strong relation attributes are discarded when duplicating an entity.

enable_relation_picker.description: When enable_relation_picker is set to true the user will be able to pick existing relations as values. Otherwise, the user will need to create new relation to link.

details_view_mode_enabled.description: Enables the preview, edition, and creation of relation items on a Master-Details view mode.

action_type.description:
The action type. Currently supported actions:

| action | description |
|--------|-------------|
| add_existing | Enables the user to pick an existing entity to link as relation |
| create_new | Enables the user to create a new entity using the first/main `allowed_schemas` schema
| create_from_existing | Enables the user to pick an existing entity to clone from, while creating a blank new entity to link as relation |

label.description: The action label or action translation key (i18n)

default.description: Sets the action as the default action, visible as the main action button.

feature_flag.description: Name of the feature flag that enables this action

settings_flag.description: This action should only be active when all the settings have the correct value

anyOf.description: The field name from the entity attributes to display

enable_relation_tags.description: When enable_relation_tags is set to true the user will be able to set tags(labels) in each relation item.

add_button_label.description: Optional label for the add button. The translated value for add_button_lable is used, if found else the string is used as is.

search_placeholder.description: Optional placeholder text for the relation search input. The translated value for search_placeholder is used, if found else the string is used as is.

allOf.description: Reference to an address attribute of another entity
Reference to a payment method attribute of another entity

relation_affinity_mode.description: Weak repeatable attributes are kept when duplicating an entity. Strong repeatable attributes are discarded when duplicating an entity.

enable_relation_picker.description: when enable_relation_picker is set to true the user will be able to pick existing relations as values. Otherwise, the user will need to create new relation to link.

show_separator.description: Whether or not to show a thousands separator

allOf.description: Type of attribute to render N number of ordered fields

An attribute that is computed from the entity data. For more details on how to use them, check the docs [here](https://e-pilot.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EO/pages/5642977476/How+To+Computed+Schema+Attributes)

SummaryAttribute.description:
Represents an expanded version of an attribute to be displayed in the list item summary.
This configuration can be used in the following way:
```js
{
  "label": "Price components"
  "value": "{{item.prices.length}} price components"
  "show_as_tag": true
  "render_condition": "is_composite_price = "true""
}
```
The value field supports handlebar expressions from which you can pick any field from the entity state.

label.description: Label to be shown on the top of the value.

value.description: A static value or an handlebar expression.

show_as_tag.description: Displays the value within a tag chip.

tag_color.description: CSS hex color or CSS color name for the tag chip.

render_condition.description:
Defines the conditional rendering expression for showing this field.
When a valid expression is parsed, their evaluation defines the visibility of this attribute.
Note: Empty or invalid expression have no effect on the field visibility.

feature_flag.description: Binds summary field visibility to the feature flag state.

settings_flag.description: This summary attribute should only be visible when all the settings have the correct value

display_mode.description:
Defines the display mode of the summary attribute.
When set to `inline`, the label and value will be displayed in the same line.
When set to `block`, the label and value will be displayed in separate lines.

content_line_cap.description:
Defines the line numbers of the content.
For instance, When set to 1, the content will be displayed in a single line.

hide_label.description: When set to true, will hide the label of the field.

highlight_container.description: When set to true, will highlight the container of the field.

_manifest.description: Manifest ID used to create/update the schema group headline

allOf.description: a readonly computed ID for the entity group headline including schema slug and the headline ID

schema.description: Schema slug the capability belongs to

EntitySlug.description: URL-friendly identifier for the entity schema

EntityCapability.description: Capabilities the Entity has. Turn features on/off for entities.

title.description: Human readable title of the capability

_manifest.description: Manifest ID used to create/update the schema capabilility

hook.description: name of the hook to use

group_expanded.description: Sets the group expand/collapse default state

component.description: the component to be dynamically loaded

icon.description: Preview icon name(As in Base elements) for the capability

requiredPermission.description: Require a permission to display UI hook

feature_flag.description: This capability should only be active when the feature flag is enabled

settings_flag.description: This capability should only be active when all the settings have the correct value

allOf.description: a readonly computed ID for the entity capability including schema slug and the capability ID

schema.description: Schema slug the capability belongs to

summary_attributes.description: List of attribute names that we show in the summary header

_org.description: Organization Id the entity belongs to

_manifest.description: Manifest ID used to create/update the entity

EntityOwner.description:
The user / organization owning this entity.

Note: Owner implicitly has access to the entity regardless of ACLs.

EntityAcl.description: Access control list (ACL) for an entity. Defines sharing access to external orgs or users.

HydratedEntity.description: Entity with relation data resolved into the attribute values

EntityValidationError.description: Validation error for an entity attribute

path.description: The path to the attribute that failed validation

message.description: A human-readable message describing the error

EntityValidationResultSuccess.description: Validation result for a successful validation

EntityValidationResultError.description: Validation result for a failed validation

instance_path.description: JSON Pointer to the location in the data instance (e.g., `"/prop/1/subProp"`).

schema_path.description: JSON Pointer to the location of the failing keyword in the schema.

property_name.description: Set for errors in `propertyNames` keyword schema. `instance_path` still points to the object in this case.

schema.description: The value of the failing keyword in the schema.

data.description: The data validated by the keyword.

EntityValidationV2ResultSuccess.description: Validation result for a successful validation

EntityValidationV2ResultError.description: Validation result for a failed validation

org_id.description: Organization Id the entity belongs to

reverse.description: Whether this is a reverse relation

EntitySearchIncludeDeletedParam.description:
Whether to include deleted entities in the search results
- `true`: include deleted entities
- `false`: exclude deleted entities
- `only`: include only deleted entities

By default, no deleted entities are included in the search results.

include_scores.description: Adds a `_score` number field to results that can be used to rank by match score

allow_targeting_all_schemas.description: Allow running the listing without any schema filter. This is disabled by default to prevent security and performance issues if done by an accident.

SearchFilter.description: A subset of simplified Elasticsearch query clauses. The default operator is a logical AND. Use nested $and, $or, $not to combine filters using different logical operators.

term.description:
Returns documents that contain an exact term in a provided field.

To return a document, the query term must exactly match the queried field's value, including whitespace and capitalization.

You likely DO NOT want to use this filter on text fields and want to target its .keyword instead.

terms.description: Returns documents that contain one of the exact terms in a provided field. See term filter for more info.

ids.description: Returns documents based on their IDs.

range.description: Returns documents with fields that have terms within a certain range.

format.description: The date format used to parse date values.

relation.description: Indicates how the range query matches values for range fields.

time_zone.description: Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset or IANA time zone used to convert date values in the query to UTC.

exists.description: Returns documents that have a value in the specified field.

sort.description: You can pass one sort field or an array of sort fields. Each sort field can be a string

size.description: Max search size is 1000 with higher values defaulting to 1000

hydrate.description: When true, enables entity hydration to resolve nested $relation & $relation_ref references in-place.

aggs.description: Aggregation supported by ElasticSearch allows summarizing data as metrics, statistics, or other analytics.

FieldsParam.description:
List of entity fields to include or exclude in the response

Use ! to exclude fields, e.g. `!_id` to exclude the `_id` field.

Globbing and globstart (**) is supported for nested fields.

bucket.description: The name of the S3 bucket where the JSON file for import is stored.

key.description: The key or path to the JSON file within the S3 bucket.

S3Reference.description: The S3 bucket and key where the JSON file for import is located.

schema.description: The schema of the entities being imported. This must match the schema of the entities on the platform.

SearchMappings.description: Advanced: explicit Elasticsearch index mapping definitions for entity data

title.description: Title for activity. Supports handlebars syntax.

message.description: Message for activity. Supports handlebars syntax.

pending.description:
Indicates whether the activity is in the pending state.
Pending activities are not yet visible in the activity feed and events are not yet dispatched.

operations_total.description: Count of total operations attached to this activity

SavedViewId.description: Generated uuid for a saved view

slug.description: list of schemas a view can belong to

name.description: User-friendly identifier for the saved view

org.description: Organisation ID a view belongs to

shared.description: boolean property for if a view is shared with organisation

isFavoritedBy.description: List of users (IDs) that have favorited the view

anyOf.description: A user that created the view

shared_with.description: List of users ('${userId}'), user groups ('group_${groupId}'), or partner users ('${partnerOrgId}_${partnerUserId}') that the view is shared with

name.description: A human friendly name of a Taxonomy e.g. Purpose, Product Category, Folder, Tag

plural.description: Plural name of a Taxonomy e.g. Purposes, Product Categories, Folders, Tags. Defaults to name is not provided.

kind.description: Kind of taxonomy e.g. system or user_defined. By default, it's empty, which means 'user_defined'

icon.description: Icon name for the taxonomy (from epilot360/icons icon set)

color.description: HEX Color code for the taxonomy

deleted_at.description: Date when the taxonomy was soft-deleted (enabled: false)

enabled.description: Whether the taxonomy is enabled or not

enabled_locations.description: List of locations where the taxonomy is enabled to be used. If empty, it's enabled for all locations.

archived.description: Archived classification are not visible in the UI

_manifest.description: Manifest ID used to create/update the taxonomy classification

TaxonomyBulkJobStatus.description: The status of the bulk job

progress.description: Progress of the job on a scale of 0 to 1

orgId.description: The organization for which the cluster assignment is returned

cluster.description: Name of the elastic cluster the organization is assigned to

name.description: The name of the organization setting to check

enabled.description: Whether the setting should be enabled or not

ErrorObject.description: A generic error returned by the API

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

AsyncOperationQueryParam.name: async
AsyncOperationQueryParam.description: Don't wait for updated entity to become available in Search API. Useful for large migrations

HydrateEntitiesQueryParam.name: hydrate
HydrateEntitiesQueryParam.description: When true, enables entity hydration to resolve nested $relation & $relation_ref references in-place.

ActivityIdQueryParam.name: activity_id
ActivityIdQueryParam.description: Activity to include in event feed

IncludeReverseDeprecatedQueryParam.name: include_reverse
IncludeReverseDeprecatedQueryParam.description:
When true, includes reverse relations in response (other entities pointing to this entity)
*It gets overriden by mode query parameter.*

IncludeReverseQueryParam.name: include_reverse
IncludeReverseQueryParam.description: When true, includes reverse relations in response (other entities pointing to this entity)

IncludeSchemasQueryParam.name: include_schemas
IncludeSchemasQueryParam.description: Filter results to only include schemas

EntityRelationsModeQueryParam.name: mode
EntityRelationsModeQueryParam.description:
Options to determine how relations will be included in the result.
*It overrides the include_reverse query param.*
Explanation of possible options:
- direct: include relations to which the searched entity refers
- reverse: include relations that refer to the entity you are looking for
- both: both direct and reverse relations

DryRunQueryParam.name: dry_run
DryRunQueryParam.description: Dry Run mode = return results but does not perform the operation.

FillActivityQueryParam.name: fill_activity
FillActivityQueryParam.description:
Update the diff and entity for the custom activity included in the query.
Pending state on activity is automatically ended when activity is filled.

ValidateEntityQueryParam.name: validate
ValidateEntityQueryParam.description: When true, enables entity validation against the entity schema.
